title: Prevent nagging update notifications in version 102
content:
My wife and I are still on T'Bird 102 on our Macs. After inadvertently replacing 102 with 115 on Windows, we will absolutely not downgrade to 115 for the foreseeable future. But in 102, the only update settings I can find are either to automatically update, or automatically check for updates and nag us. The nagging has been an issue for months now, since previous versions of 10x have broken the ability to read POP mail, to send mail, etc, so we have had to back-install previous versions. But always that whining, nagging update notice.

Is there any way to stop that?
creator: greggbrickner

title: How to start the setting of Mozilla TB to direct my email traffic from a sleuth of email client accounts?
content:
How to start the setting of Mozilla TB to direct my email traffic from a sleuth of email client accounts? I do have 10+ free Yahoo email accounts, Plus free Proton, Tutanota and Gmx accounts. I would like to follow a step by step process to integrate all those accounts under Mozilla Thunderbird to be able to see, open, read and eventually edit and modify my emails. Could you offer to Me all the links with tutorials that would teach me how to get the results I am looking for?

Also, in a second stage I would like to integrate Mozilla TB with SeaMonkey and also with MultCloud and other third party cloud free services. like Box, Mega, OneCrive, OneNote, etc

P would like if possible to get your response to my email linked to this account.

Awaiting your reply with my thanks

Charlie B
creator: MSwhip

title: Update to Thunderbird 115.3.3 Corrupted Profile
content:
I recently updated Thunderbird to 115.3.3. When the update was complete it appears to have split my profile into two and created two of Inbox, Drafts, Sent, and Trash. I use Earthlink which is the name of the POP3 account. Now there are Inbox, Drafts, Sent, and Trash for "Earthlink", and a set for "Local Folders". Junk and Archives are only associated with "Local Folders", and "Outbox" shows up under a "Local Folders" header along with all of the folders I used to organize received messages. When new messages are downloaded they appear in "Inbox / Local Folders". Nothing appears in any of the "Earthlink / ..." folders.

I don't recall exactly what it looked like before but there was only one set of the primary folders, and the local folders I created to organize my inbox. I have attached screenshots of the the folder navigation pane, as well as the odd organization of the "Account Settings" tab. I am admittedly not an expert. Any help is appreciated.
creator: pete48

title: Constant crashes with new version of Thunderbird.
content:
Didnt use Thunderbird for 2 weeks. On return from trip last week, tried to open what seems to be a new version of TBird. Tried many times--each time crashed. Tried troubleshooting mode--also crashed each time. Has never opened in the new format.

title: Edit Address Book entry
content:

In fact the address book is no longer found under Tools.

title: CANNOT ACCESS MY ATT SBCGLOBAL EMAILS ON THUNDERBIRD
content: THUNDERBIRD IS WORKING FOR MY G-MAILS BUT NOT MY ATT SBCGLOBAL EMAILS. PASSWORDS ON ATT SITE WAS PUT IN WHEN ASKED FOR EACH EMAIL IN THUNDERBIRD. BUT INDICATES Login to server inbound.att.net with username rudbusiness@sbcglobal.net failed.
